Pre-Game Insights: Teemu Pukki believes the Wales game will be tight, similar to their previous Nations League matches against Wales.
Pukki thinks the team has been doing well over the last four years and wants to win the game to bring themselves to another final.
This is Finland's last chance to qualify for Euro 2024.
Pukki has 39 goals from 118 caps and is within 20 of Jari Litmanen's Finnish record.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Teemu Pukki is flourishing at Minnesota in MLS, scoring 12 goals in 18 appearances.
Pukki has been coaxed by Celtic to the Scottish Premiership in 2013 and lasted a quarter of a four-year deal after struggling for form and confidence.
Pukki has looked on with envy as three of his close friends from those Norwich days – Kenny McLean, Angus Gunn and Grant Hanley – reached the Euros with Scotland.
Others: Finland's goalkeeper Lukas Hradecky is world-class and has helped the team with clean sheets.
Pukki has a great team spirit with Finland and knows exactly how to play with each other.
